content: Credit Card YouTrip Asked by AnonymousAsked on 27 Jul 2019Does anyone know if top-up into YouTrip using the Standard Charted X card counts towards rewards expenditure?Currently using the Standard Charted X credit card and plan to link it to my YouTrip account. Does anyone know if the expenditure on it counts towards my rewards?3 answersAnswerBump3
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Javier Lim, Financial Consultant at Prudential Assurance Company SingaporeLevel 5. GeniusUpdated on 28 Jul 2019Nope, they are excluded for both Rewards and the 100k Miles Sign Up Gift Qualifying Transaction; you can refer to points 26n and 57n in the T&Chttps://av.sc.com/sg/content/docs/x-card-tnc.pdf0 comments4

Clarence Chua, Financial Planning Specialist at Prudential Assurance SingaporeTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterAnswered on 27 Jul 2019Most top ups into such cards will not count towards your rewards. Similar to topping up of ez-link. You can always clarify with the bank staffs too. ðŸ˜Š0 comments4

Guo Hao Teo, Self-Taught Enthusiast at Personal FinanceLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 27 Jul 2019No you cannot use it for prepaid card topups which include grabpay and youtrip.It is in the Terms and conditions, i was finding it also!0 comments0
